name: async-task-packer
description: This is a zero-dependency and low-footprint library that allows you to pack a set of asynchronous tasks and execute them in a controlled way. It allows you to execute those tasks in time-based intervals or in size-based chunks.

scripts.check: npm run prettier && npm run lint && npm test
scripts.build: npm run check && rimraf dist && NODE_ENV=production node esbuild.js && npm run ts-types
scripts.release:common: npm run build && git push --follow-tags origin main && npm publish --access public
scripts.release:patch: changelog -p && git add CHANGELOG.md && git commit -m 'docs: updated changelog' && npm version patch && npm run release:common
scripts.release:minor: changelog -m && git add CHANGELOG.md && git commit -m 'docs: updated changelog' && npm version minor && npm run release:common
scripts.release:major: changelog -M && git add CHANGELOG.md && git commit -m 'docs: updated changelog' && npm version major && npm run release:common

author: Michael Di Prisco <cadienvan@gmail.com>
